clinical_study.brief_title: Locking Compression Plate Fixation Versus Revision- Prosthesis of Vancouver-B2, B3 and C Periprosthetic Femoral Fractures After Total Hip Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Locking Compression Plate Fixation Versus Revision- Prosthesis of Vancouver-B2, B3 and C Periprosthetic Femoral Fractures After Total Hip Replacement

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to compare the clinical (range of motion, weight bearing, quality of life) and radiographic outcome (boney consolidation) between open reduction and internal fixation using locking compression plates with revision prosthesis using a non-cemented long femoral stem in a group of patients with a Vancouver type-B2, B3 and C periprosthetic fracture after primary total hip replacement.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Outcome (Range of Motion of the hip)
primary_outcome.time_frame: follow up of at least 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Range of Motion of the hip

primary_outcome.measure: Radiographic Outcome (boney consolidation of the fracture)
primary_outcome.time_frame: follow up of at least 1 year
primary_outcome.description: boney consolidation of the fracture after 3 month, 6 month and at least 1 year after the operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's Mobility (assessed by the Parker's Mobility Score)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: follow up of at least 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's Mobility assessed by the Parker's Mobility Score

arm_group.description: Patients treated with the second generation long-stem revision prosthesis
Patients treated with the first generation long-stem revision prosthesis

intervention.intervention_name: Operation for Periprosthetic fractures of the hip with stem loosening

study_pop.textblock: We retrospectively reviewed a consecutive series of 102 patients with Vancouver type-B2, B3 and C periprosthetic fractures and unstable femoral stem, which had been prospectively entered, in our hip-trauma database.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Vancouver type- BlI, BIII and C fractures and unstable femoral prosthesis stem.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with pathological fractures,
- Vancouver type-A, Bl, and
- stable femoral prosthesis stem,
- Patients with hemi - prosthesis and periprosthetic femoral fractures were excluded from final analysis.
